newsitem.title: USA: US LPGs slow as sellers want yesterday's prices.
newsitem.headline: US LPGs slow as sellers want yesterday's prices.

text.p: U.S. spot liquefied petroleum gas prices were mostly unchanged in thin trading Thursday following Wednesday's gains.
Traders said the lack of LPG activity reflected Thursday's crude oil fall on the NYMEX.
Propane values in the Mont Belevieu, Texas, market were unchanged at 35.25 and 35.50 cents a gallon, but August propane deals were made at 35.63 cents a gallon.
Propane values in the Conway, Kansas, were a quarter cent firmer at 34.50/34.75 cents, but players said no deals had been heard done.
"Everyone seems to have taken care of what was on their books," said one trader, "my phone isn't ringing."
In one of the few deals heard done at the Conway hub midday was natural gasoline at 45.00 cents. August material there was pegged at 44.75/45.00 cents.
Isobutane values moved the most in Conway. It was pegged 0.75 cent higher at 42.00/42.75 cents.
"Sellers are trying to get yesterday's values," said one trader, "but the buyers are basically hiding." --Tim Gardner, New York Oil Desk +1 212 859 1632 --
